The searches performed indicate the following significant corporate developments for the ADANIENT Ltd (Adani Group) on August 23, 2025:

Adani Realty, a part of the Adani Group, inaugurated an exclusive business chamber called 'The Imperial' at the Belvedere Golf and Country Club in Adani Shantigram.

Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone announced the groundbreaking ceremony for a new logistics park in Kalamassery, Kochi.

Adani Enterprises reported the incorporation of a step-down wholly owned subsidiary company in a stock exchange filing with both the NSE and BSE.

On August 23, 2025, ADANIPORTS Ltd announced a significant corporate development: the groundbreaking of its new logistics park in Kochi .

Key details of the announcement include:

Project: The Adani Logistics Park was initiated in the Kalamassery industrial region in Kochi.

Investment: The project is part of the 'Invest in Kerala' programme and involves an investment of over Rs 600 crore.

Strategic importance: The park marks a key milestone in APSEZ's expansion from a port-focused enterprise into a fully integrated transport and logistics business.

Features: The new facility will span 70 acres and incorporate smart logistics solutions, digital integration, and EV charging stations.

Economic impact: The park is expected to generate more than 1,500 jobs and support the growth of local businesses.

On August 22, 2025, a significant block deal was executed by APOLLOHOSP Ltd., but no substantial corporate developments were reported specifically on August 23, 2025 .

Block deal on August 22, 2025

Since there was no significant corporate news on August 23, 2025, the most relevant event from that period is the block deal.

What happened:On the day before the requested date, promoter Suneeta Reddy sold a 1.3% stake in Apollo Hospitals Enterprise via a block deal for ₹1,489 crore.

Reason:The sale was done to help the promoter group reduce debt and reduce pledged holdings.

Aftermath:The promoter group stated they did not plan any further stake reductions in the foreseeable future.

On August 23, 2025, Bajaj Auto resumed supplies of its Chetak electric scooter . This follows a production slowdown in previous months due to global supply chain disruptions involving rare earth magnets. The company has resolved the issue and secured a stable supply, enabling it to accelerate deliveries ahead of the festive season.

Announcement:Bajaj Auto announced it had resumed the supply of its Chetak e-scooter and had resolved a magnet supply issue.

Production target:The company aimed to deliver more than 15,000 Chetak e-scooters and 7,000 electric three-wheelers in August.

Industry context:This move came after a decline in Chetak deliveries, as the company had cut its electric two-wheeler production by 50% in July due to the rare earth magnet shortage.

According to a report published by BW Businessworld , the Indian government was considering slashing the Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) dues for telecom companies, including Bharti Airtel.

Article title:"Government To Slash AGR Dues For Telecom Majors".

Publication date:August 23, 2025.

Corporate update:Sources reported that a proposal reviewed by the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) could significantly reduce Bharti Airtel's AGR dues from an estimated ₹42,000 crore to approximately ₹10,000 crore. This followed previous judicial rulings on the matter.

Impact:If approved, this development would represent a substantial reduction in the company's liabilities and positively affect its financial outlook.

BW Businessworld

On August 23, 2025, Hindustan Unilever Ltd. (HINDUNILVR) announced a change to its leadership team . This followed a related, more detailed announcement made on August 21.

This is the only substantial corporate news found for JSWSTEEL Ltd around that time.

On August 18, 2025, JSW Steel and POSCO Group signed an HoA to explore a potential joint venture to establish a 6 MTPA integrated steel plant in India.

Proposed partnership:The HoA outlines the framework for a 50:50 joint venture.

Plant location:A detailed feasibility study will be conducted to determine the plant's location, investment, and resource requirements. Odisha is being considered as a primary site.

Strategic rationale:The venture aims to combine POSCO's advanced technology with JSW's operational capabilities, aligning with India's "Atmanirbhar Bharat" initiative to create a globally competitive manufacturing hub.

On August 23, 2025, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) approved Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation's (SMBC) plan to acquire up to a 24.99% stake in Yes Bank . Kotak Mahindra Bank was listed as one of the shareholders that would sell its stake as part of this deal.

Corporate development for KOTAKBANK Ltd on August 23, 2025:

The RBI's approval of the SMBC-Yes Bank deal is a significant corporate development for Kotak Mahindra Bank because the bank was one of seven lenders offloading shares as part of the secondary purchase. The SMBC stake purchase, following an initial plan to raise its holding to 20%, involved Kotak and other institutional shareholders.

On August 23, 2025, Mahindra & Mahindra announced that its limited-edition BE 6 Batman electric SUV sold out all 999 units in just 135 seconds .

Limited edition sellout: The bookings for theBE 6 Batman Editionopened at 11:00 AM on August 23, 2025, and were fully sold out within 135 seconds.

Production increase: Following high demand, Mahindra increased the production from the originally planned 300 units to 999.

WBDGCP collaboration: TheBE 6 Batman Editionis the result of Mahindra's first collaboration with Warner Bros. Discovery Global Consumer Products.

Vehicle details: The EV is based on the top-spec "Pack Three" variant and features a custom satin black finish, gold accents, and Batman-themed interior and exterior insignias.

On August 23, 2025, SBI Life Insurance was featured in news regarding strong individual sum assured growth, and it was impacted by the broader insurance industry news about a potential GST exemption .

Key news stories for SBILIFE Ltd on August 23, 2025:

Strong performance in sum assured growth:A report by brokerage firm ICICI Securities highlighted that SBI Life, along with ICICI Prudential and Axis Max Life, were the top performers in individual sum assured growth during the first four months of FY26. SBI Life recorded a growth of 81.7% in this category.

Impact of potential GST cut:The insurance industry, including SBI Life, was in focus due to a potential GST rate cut on health and term insurance premiums. The proposed cut was part of a GST 2.0 plan to reduce the burden on citizens and could affect insurers' margins and pricing strategies.

On August 23, 2025, a significant corporate development for State Bank of India (SBIN) was a scheduled maintenance activity that temporarily disabled several digital banking services .

Digital services temporarily unavailable

While other news was published around this date, such as market commentary and reports on a CBI raid on Anil Ambani following an SBI complaint, the planned service outage was the most directly material corporate action taken by SBI on August 23, 2025.

Time:6:30 AM to 7:00 AM IST on August 23, 2025.

Affected services:UPI, IMPS, YONO, YONO Business, Internet Banking (INB), NEFT, and RTGS.

Alternative services:Customers were advised to use ATMs and UPI Lite for their banking needs during the downtime.

Resumption of services:All services resumed by 7:00 AM the same day.

On August 23, 2025, Tech Mahindra (TECHM) reported the following substantial corporate developments :

Director appointment: At a board meeting, the company approved the appointment of Ms. Ketaki Naginbhai Patel as a Non-Executive Independent Director for a five-year term.

Avion Systems stake: The company acquired a minority stake in Avion Systems, a global telecom technology firm. Tech Mahindra and Avion Systems also established a new joint venture.

Committee reconstitution: The board also approved the reconstitution of several committees, effective the same day, following the appointment of the new director.

Cost auditor appointment: The board appointed M/s. Joshi Apte & Associates as the cost auditor for the financial year 2025–26, pending shareholder approval.

Analysis of HARMAN DTS acquisition
